 340:     #TODO: The problems with Rocker wavelet smoothing, as currently implemented, are that:
 341:     #1.The wavelet-smoothed light curve has correlated data points, so the original statistics are lost. 
 342:     #In reality, the scatter has been diminished by about the square root of the number  of data points in the width of the wavelet 
 343:     #(which is 6 or 7 data points, if I recall correctly)
 344:     #2.The mean level has been scaled and/or shifted in a way that we (I, at least) don’t currently understand.
